verses: And it came to pass on the day that Moses had fully
up the tabernacle, and had anointed it, and sanctified it, and all the instruments thereof, both the altar and all the vessels thereof, and had anointed them, and sanctified them;
of the house of their fathers, who
the princes of the tribes, and were over them that were numbered, offered:
And they brought their offering before the
, and twelve oxen; a wagon for two of the princes, and for each one an ox: and they brought them before the tabernacle.
of them, that they may be to do the service of the
; and thou shalt give them unto the Levites, to every man according to his service.
And Moses took the wagons and the oxen, and gave them unto the Levites.
Two wagons and four oxen he gave unto the sons of Gershon, according to their service:
And four wagons and eight oxen he gave unto the sons of Merari, according unto their service, under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
But unto the sons of Kohath he gave none: because the service of the sanctuary belonging unto them
they should bear upon their shoulders.
And the princes offered for dedicating of the altar in the day that it was anointed, even the princes offered their offering before the altar.
said unto Moses, They shall offer their offering,
prince on his day, for the dedicating of the altar.
And he that offered his offering the first day was Nahshon the son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Judah:
one silver charger, the weight thereof
one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them
full of fine flour mingled with oil for a
One young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
One kid of the goats for a sin offering:
And for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this
the offering of Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
On the second day Nethaneel the son of Zuar,
his offering one silver charger, the weight whereof

one silver charger of the weight of an hundred and thirty

one silver charger, the weight whereof

And all the oxen for the sacrifice of the peace offerings
twenty and four bullocks, the rams sixty, the he goats sixty, the lambs of the first year sixty. This
the dedication of the altar, after that it was anointed.
